PCR was the commonest finding in our study which could be explained by the use of PCR instead of culture. not all viral respiratory tract infections cause fever, and different virus types are known to be variously pyrogenic. bacterial culture is limited in sensitivity, but it is of interest to note that virus existed more often as the sole pathogen identified here than as a cofactor with bacteria. both respiratory virus infections and low titers of viruses in blood from patients with neutropenia were common. viral findings in NPA were associated to URTS indicating active infection.
